title: 81x33: Testimony before an Agency and 18 U.S.C. § 207
summary: 18 U.S.C. § 207 would not prohibit a former senior agency employee from appearing as a state expert witness in a hearing before a second agency if the subject matter of his testimony were limited to the validity of the investigations and methodologies used by the other consultant that the state had retained to produce data to be used at the hearing.
